text.0: even to him swift strong and high exalted i bring my song of praise as dainty viands.
text.1: my thought to him resistless praisedeserving prayers offered most especially to indra.
text.2: praise like oblation i present and utter aloud my song my fair hymn to the victor.
text.3: for indra who is lord of old the singers have decked their lauds with heart and mind and spirit.
text.4: to him then with my lips mine adoration winning heavens light most excellent i offer.
text.5: to magnify with songs of invocation and with fair hymns the lord most bounteous giver.
text.6: even for him i frame a laud as fashions the wright a chariot for the man who needs it.
text.7: praises to him who gladly hears our praises a hymn wellformed allmoving to wise indra.
text.8: so with my tongue i deck to please that indra my hymn as twere a horse through love of glory.
text.9: to reverence the hero bounteous giver famed far and wide destroyer of the castles.
text.10: even for him hath tvaṣṭar forged the thunder most deftly wrought celestial for the battle.
text.11: wherewith he reached the vital parts of vṛtra strikingthe vast the mighty with the striker.
text.12: as soon as at libations of his mother great viṣṇu had drunk up the draught he plundered.
text.13: the dainty cates the cooked mess but one stronger transfixed the wild boar shooting through the mountain.
text.14: to him to indra when he slew the dragon the dames too consorts of the gods wove praises.
text.15: the mighty heaven and earth hath he encompassed thy greatness heaven and earth combined exceed not.
text.16: yea of a truth his magnitude surpasseth the magnitude of earth midair and heaven.
text.17: indra approved by all men selfresplendent waxed in his home loudvoiced and strong for battle.
text.18: through his own strength indra with bolt of thunder cut piecemeal vṛtra drier up of waters.
text.19: he let the floods go free like cows imprisoned for glory with a heart inclined to bounty.
text.20: the rivers played through his impetuous splendour since with his bolt he compassed them on all sides.
text.21: using his might and favouring him who worshipped he made a ford victorious for turvīti.
text.22: vast with thine ample power with eager movement against this vṛtra cast thy bolt of thunder.
text.23: rend thou his joints as of an ox dissevered with bolt oblique that floods of rain may follow.
text.24: sing with new lauds his exploits wrought aforetime the deeds of him yea him who moveth swiftly.
text.25: when hurling forth his weapons in the battle he with impetuous wrath lays low the foemen.
text.26: when he yea he comes forth the firm set mountains and the whole heaven and earth tremble for terror.
text.27: may nodhas ever praising the protection of that dear friend gain quickly strength heroic.
text.28: now unto him of these things hath been given what he who rules alone oer much electeth.
text.29: indra hath helped etaśa somapresser contending in the race of steeds with sūrya.
text.30: thus to thee indra yoker of bay coursers the gotamas have brought their prayers to please thee.
text.31: bestow upon them thought decked with all beauty may he enriched with prayer come soon and early.
